attributes.action: Sickle cell disease should be classified a disability
attributes.additional_details:
Why does this disease need to be classified as a disability 
1, Suffers have been stigmatized as being lazy in the  work place 
2 Children that have suffered this have been stigmatized excluded from schools  society 
3, Suffers have been made homeless due to rent arrears caused because of frequent hospital visits.
4, Suicide increase for surfers that have been regected by society 
In conclusion we appeal to Government to make living with this disability more bearable.
Please sign these petition.
attributes.background:
Sickle cell disease is a genetic blood disorder 
Sickle cell anaemia can lead to
Increased risk of severe bacterial infections due to loss of functioning spleen tissue.
Stroke narrowing of oxygen from reaching the brain.
Silent stroke
Cholelithiasis(gallstones) 
kidney failure

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Disability Discrimination Act (DDA) and the Equality Act don't name specific medical conditions. In most cases, it’s the impact on the person’s life that qualifies them for support or protection under the law.

You can find out more about showing that you're disabled under the Equality Act here: 

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/law-and-courts/discrimination/protected-characteristics/showing-you-re-disabled-under-the-equality-act/ 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do to support people who are suffering from sickle cell disease.
